timeline.message: Update log statement for open distro security index
Remove opendistro index from audit log config
Move audit config to inner class AuditConfig.Filter

timeline.author: vrozov

timeline.bodyText: [suggestion]: we might consider including Lombok as a dependency in the future as it will simplify adding constructors, setters, getters and builders. Created issue https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/security/issues/363
timeline.author: debjanibnrj

timeline.bodyText: just curious, why does this flag default to false and the others to true?
timeline.author: debjanibnrj

replies.bodyText:
Retained the existing default.
Resolving bulk requests results in additional computation hence user must intentionally set to true.
replies.author: sujithvm

timeline.bodyText: Would be useful to provide doc comments for classes in the future.
timeline.author: debjanibnrj

replies.bodyText: Add private constructor for AuditConfig to avoid class misuse. It is a container for other classes inside AuditConfig.
replies.author: vrozov

timeline.bodyText: I see us using this function and then converting the output to a set. Any reason why we don't return a Set by default.
timeline.author: debjanibnrj

replies.bodyText: Converting the output to a set has an additional cost when it is passed to AuditCategory.parse() as it will be constructing a different set and checking for uniqueness again (not a big deal).
replies.author: vrozov

timeline.bodyText: nit: maybe rename this to logger. auditConfigFilter.log(log) was a little difficult for me to understand
timeline.author: debjanibnrj

replies.bodyText: I had renamed this to logger. @vrozov wanted it renamed back to log
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: @debjanibnrj It is more consistent with how Logger is named in other places and avoids unnecessary diffs.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: @vrozov Fair point with reducing diffs but auditConfigFilter.log(log) would be confusing to anyone especially because this is around audit "logging"
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: IMO, it is a problem with method name, not Logger name. Rename AuditConfig.Filter.log().
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: It is not a static function if thats what you mean.
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: I mean that the minor readability problem is caused by AuditConfig.Filter class method name log(). It is not important whether it is static or not.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: If you want it renamed to something specific I will rename as you had previously suggested to use log() otherwise let's leave this. I m fine with this.
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: I am fine the current function name or with a different function name if you want to add readability. I strongly prefer log not to be renamed to logger.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: @vrozov Can you approve this PR in that case ?
replies.author: sujithvm

timeline.bodyText: wildcard imports are generally considered bad practice.
timeline.author: debjanibnrj

replies.bodyText:
I assumed it is generally fine to have wildcard imports for constants/values.
Removing this would add 10 other import lines.
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: Seeing as your using most audit categories for the tests this is a fair point. For import static org.junit.Assert.*; it may be better to specify the specific imports.
replies.author: debjanibnrj

replies.bodyText: Should probably write a checkstyle rule for this
replies.author: sujithvm

timeline.bodyText: Consider  moving this method to AuditConfig from AuditConfig.Filter
timeline.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: Will move it when needed as this has more restricted scope as NONE handling is not used everywhere as theres plans to deprecate it.
replies.author: sujithvm

timeline.bodyText: In case conversion to Set is done inside this function, it is better to add isEmpty() check here. I am not 100% convinced that it is necessary to convert to Set from List here as it is not always necessary and in the future there may be different requirements for case-sensitivity of the returned Set.
timeline.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: Will change it when needed in the future.
replies.author: sujithvm
